message:
I require help representing Prayer names (Asr, Magrib .. etc) in ipa or x-sampa phonetic alphabet. 

I'm working on a personal project, An Amazon Alexa skill to tell me the prayer times, and i only get data from the Local mosque for now. 

I have a problem with making Alexa pronounce the prayer names correctly. The only way to do it in a decent way is by using SSML (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speech_Synthesis_Markup_Language), (https://developer.amazon.com/public/solutions/alexa/alexa-skills-kit/docs/speech-synthesis-markup-language-ssml-reference) using the ipa (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet) or x-sampa (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-SAMPA) alphabet. 

My problems is that i have no idea how to pronounce the names correctly using any of those alphabets, and i haven't found any resource for that online. 

I'd appreciate any help, specially if any one has experience with phonetic alphabets.

data.message:
Wikipedia articles usually show how to pronounce a word. Check this as an example:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zuhr_prayer
